section.title: Release Highlights
section.para: This version of KPME is a patch release consisting of bug fixes and small items needed by Kuali application partners.

listitem.para: Conversion of KPME Roles to KIM roles/permissions
Configurable, multiple level routing defined on key document types
Large scale refactoring done on project to better prepare for future releases
Numerous Bug Fixes

section.title: Download
section.para: KPME ${project.version} can be downloaded from the Kuali website at http://www.kuali.org/download/kpme.
There is a single zip file which contains both the source and binaries. Please read the Installation Guide for more details on setup of these downloads
Applications can also consume KPME from the maven site at http://search.maven.org/#search|ga|1|org.kuali.kpme.

section.title: Documentation
section.para: API Documentation can be found at http://site.kuali.org/kpme/${project.version}/apidocs/index.html

Formal documentation can be found at http://site.kuali.org/kpme/${project.version}/reference/html/index.html. This documentation is still in the process of review and update which will continue through subsequent releases, so please follow the notes in each document to report any outdated information.

listitem.para: In order to better align KPME with other Kuali project, and in order to improve usability and ease of future enhancements, KPME has move to using KIM roles, permissions, and groups.Â
If upgrading from a previous version of KPME, a groovy script is provided to generate sql that will help to migrate existing data from the HR_ROLE_T table to the KIM tables.
Service calls using java.util.Date and java.sql.Date have been altered and unified to use the JodaTime library.
Because of this change, previous maintenance documents that are in the process of being routed will not be loadable. Ideally, these should be routed to completion before upgrading to KPME 2.0.0

section.title: Renaming of CalendarEntries object to CalendarEntry

listitem.para: This class was renamed to be singular instead of plural.
Because of this change, previous documents referencing 'CalendarEntries' will no longer be loadable.
Alot of work was done to modularize the KPME project
Split into core, database, time and leave, and position management modules
Depending on the method of an existing KPME installation, this may have repercussions on dependencies and spring bean configurations.
Nearly every class has been relocated package-wise. So any existing custom overrides will need to be modified.

section.title: Contact
section.para: If you encounter any difficulty, please don't hesitate to contact the KPME team on our public collaboration mailing list at kpme.tech.collab@kuali.org. Please indicate that you are using the ${project.version} version of KPME.
